ygData.subject: Re: On alliance again
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yes but mesmerize could be resisted. Up until yesterdays patch Memory blur was an Unresistable spell. NOTHING, not even lordd mistmoore himself  would
ygData.messageBody:
At 02:46 PM 5/19/99 -0500, you wrote:
>From: "Farr, Robert" <robert.farr@...>
>

Yes but mesmerize could be resisted. Up until yesterdays patch Memory blur
was an Unresistable spell. NOTHING, not even lordd mistmoore himself would
resist it. If you ahd tried to use mesmerize in place of memory blur on a
sand giant it would ahve resisted it (being red to you) and stomped youa s
well as the rest.



>Mesmerize does the same for me. I use it all the time on wisps in Erud's
>Crossing if I get doubleteamed. I mes one and kill the other. I have never
>had the one that I mesmerized attack me again.
>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Hapke, Matthew [SMTP:mahapke@...]
>> Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 2:53 PM
>> To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
>> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
>>
>> From: "Hapke, Matthew" <mahapke@...>
>>
>> I have had whirl, just this morning, last for less then 2 seconds, 7
>> times in a row. It never lasts full duration at all, and I am fighting
>> blues, totally. Risky or dangerous, doesn't seem to matter.
>>
>> Memory Blur is what I would deem a get out of Jail free card. It is a
>> second chance basically. Against Non Agressive beasts, it is a do-over.
>> It stops them in their tracks, and makes em forget. It doesn't freeze
>> them like mez does. But, my big use for it was saving a beach full of
>> Croc surfers from the wet sandal fate. Up comes the big hill giant, out
>> goes the Memory Blur, bingo! Instantly make 20 new friends =) I don't
>> think I will try this much now, considering the giant will resist me.
>> That was the only situation I found it useful for.
>>
>>
>> > -----Original Message-----
>> > From: Farr, Robert [SMTP:robert.farr@...]
>> > Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 2:37 PM
>> > To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
>> > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
>> >
>> > From: "Farr, Robert" <robert.farr@...>
>> >
>> > I haven't had any problems with whirl. In what way is it supposed to
>> > be
>> > broken?
>> >
>> > I haven't had any problem with memory blur because I am still using
>> > mesmerize. I didn't notice that memory blur offered anything else
>> > besides an
>> > increased mana use...
>> >
>> > > -----Original Message-----
>> > > From: Hapke, Matthew [SMTP:mahapke@...]
>> > > Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 2:36 PM
>> > > To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
>> > > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
>> > >
>> > > From: "Hapke, Matthew" <mahapke@...>
>> > >
>> > > IMproved the effectiveness of what spells?!?
>> > > I have seen these improvements for us lately:
>> > >
>> > > 1. Memory Blur can now be resisted.
>> > > 2. Whirl Can now be broken
>> > > 3. Whirl now has a horridly random amount of time.
>> > >
>> > > So, what exactly is better here?
>> > >
>> > > > -----Original Message-----
>> > > > From: Shawn Alley [SMTP:ShawnA@...]
>> > > > Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 2:23 PM
>> > > > To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com'
>> > > > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
>> > > >
>> > > > From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>
>> > > >
>> > > > Variant just improved the effectiveness of some spells. They may
>> > work
>> > > > on this spell (and others) if we continue to let them know the
>> > spell
>> > > > isn't doing what we expected. So keep your hopes up, this line of
>> > > > spells may be more powerful at some point!
>> > > >
>> > > > -----Original Message-----
>> > > > From: HiFi Review [mailto:hifireview@...]
>> > > > Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 12:18 PM
>> > > > To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
>> > > > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] On alliance again
>> > > >
>> > > >
>> > > > From: HiFi Review <hifireview@...>
>> > > >
>> > > > Then we can save a few coppers on our 100PP + platinum bars. :)
>> > > >
>> > > > --- Rob Berryhill <racefan@...> wrote:
>> > > > > From: "Rob Berryhill" <racefan@...>
>> > > > >
>> > > > > It's pretty much worthless. If you use it for an
>> > > > > item that costs 100+pp you
>> > > > > *might* save a copper or two.
>> > > > >
